document.docTitle: Dichromadora multisetosa Huang & Zhang 2010, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of Dichromadora (Nematoda: Chromadorida: Chromadoridae) from the Yellow Sea, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of Dichromadora (Nematoda: Chromadorida: Chromadoridae) from the Yellow Sea, China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Five males and four females were observed. Holotype : one male , specimen number of new species: LU62 (slide number: LUQ08 I 345)
;
paratypes : 14 males 10 females LU63–70
( LUQ08 I 341,3,6, LUQ08 III 403 )
.
Intertidal muddy sediment at Qingdao coast of the Yellow Sea: 36°4′ N , 120°19′ E . Etymology

caption.paragraph:
Figure 3.
Dichromadora multisetosa
sp. nov. (A) lateral view of male body; (B) lateral view of female anterior end, showing buccal cavity, tooth, bulb, lateral punctuation and ventral gland cell; (C) lateral view of male tail end, showing spicule and gubernacular apophysis; (D) lateral view of female body, showing vulva and ovary.

subSubSection.paragraph: This species is named after the many long somatic setae all over the body.

The measurements are listed in Table 2 . Holotype , one male : 86 M 441 516 µm; a = 20, b = 6, c = 6.9, spic = 34, 14, 22, 26, 21. Paratype , one male : 86 V 396 476 µm; a = 16.4, b = 5.5, c = 6, V% = 50%, 14, 26, 29, 21.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 4.
Dichromadora multisetosa
sp. nov. (A) lateral view of male body; (B) lateral view of female anterior end, showing dorsal tooth, anterior dorsal bulb and posterior bulb; (C) lateral view of female anterior end, showing somatic setae and ovary.; (D) lateral view of male body, showing spicule and gubernacular apophysis.

Table 2. Individual measurements (and average) of
Dichromadora multisetosa
sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Males. Body is cylindrical, blunt at the anterior end and attenuating at the tail end ( Figure 3A,D ); 474–535 µm in length and 23–26 µm in maximum diameter. Cuticle is homogeneous with transverse rows of punctations. There are two longitudinal rows of thick round dots as lateral differentiation that extend from the anterior to the posterior end. Long somatic setae, up to 19 µm are in four sublateral files down the body length.

Females. Similar to males. The reproductive system is amphidelphic with reflexed ovaries, anterior branch located to the right of the intestine and posterior one to the left of it. The vulva is simple, at 50% of body length from the anterior end.

Dichromadora multisetosa
sp. nov. is characterized by the presence of a clearly anterior dorsal bulb and rounded posterior pharyngeal bulb, long somatic setae and a broad dorsal caudal apophysis of gubernaculum. It is the only species that has gubernaculum with dorsocaudal apophysis in this genus. The species can be distinguished from other
Dichromadora species
described without precloacal supplements by clearly rounded posterior pharyngeal bulb, long somatic setae and a broad dorsocaudal apophysis of gubernaculum.
